camel.sink.path.connectionBean.name: camel.sink.path.connectionBean
camel.sink.path.connectionBean.description: Connection to the influx database, of class InfluxDB.class

camel.sink.endpoint.batch.name: camel.sink.endpoint.batch
camel.sink.endpoint.batch.description: Define if this operation is a batch operation or not

camel.sink.endpoint.databaseName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.databaseName
camel.sink.endpoint.databaseName.description: The name of the database where the time series will be stored

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: Define if this operation is an insert or a query

camel.sink.endpoint.query.name: camel.sink.endpoint.query
camel.sink.endpoint.query.description: Define the query in case of operation query

camel.sink.endpoint.retentionPolicy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.retentionPolicy
camel.sink.endpoint.retentionPolicy.description: The string that defines the retention policy to the data created by the endpoint

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.influxdb.influxDB.name: camel.component.influxdb.influxDB
camel.component.influxdb.influxDB.description: The shared Influx DB to use for all endpoints

camel.component.influxdb.lazyStartProduc.name: camel.component.influxdb.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.influxdb.lazyStartProduc.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.influxdb.basicPropertyBi.name: camel.component.influxdb.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.influxdb.basicPropertyBi.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
